src:
Edhy Prabowo Siap Tambah Kapasitas Gudang Garam Rakyat
05 Nov 2019, 10:35 by Dias Prasongko, Kodrat Setiawan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Menteri Kelautan dan Perikanan (KKP) Edhy Prabowo menyatakan siap menambah kapasitas gudang untuk garam rakyat atau yang dihasilkan petani/petambak. Langkah ini ditempuh sejalan dengan program geomembrane untuk menjaga harga garam tetap stabil sekaligus meningkatkan produksi dan kualitas.
"Cari cara bagaimana para petambak garam penghasilannya baik. Salah satunya lewat geomembran. Pembuatan gudang juga cukup besar, ini akan terus kami lakukan," kata Edhy usai mengikuti rapat di Kementerian Koordinator Bidang Perekonomian, Jakarta Pusat, Selasa 5 November 2019.
Edhy mengatakan KKP siap jika diminta untuk menambah kapasitas gudang bagi garam petani. Kendati begitu, dia belum bisa memastikan berapa tambahan kapasitas yang akan diperlukan. Dia mengatakan masih akan melihat lebih lanjut kebutuhan bagi petani/petambak.
Adapun saat ini total kapasitas gudang bagi garam milik petani/petambak mencapai angka 49 ribu ton. Rata-rata gudang untuk garam tersebut memiliki kapasitas antara 3-4 ribu ton.
Sebelumnya, KKP berencana terus mengembangkan berbagai sentra garam di berbagai daerah. Hal ini dilakukan dalam rangka menghasilkan produksi garam yang berkualitas dari petani/petambak garam.
Direktur Jenderal Pengelolaan Ruang Laut KKP Brahmantya Satyamurti Poerwadi mengatakan program itu akan dilakukan lewat Program Usaha Garam Rakyat. Sampai akhir 2018, KKP telah mengembangkan 23 kabupaten sebagai sentra garam.
Dari total jumlah tersebut, sudah terdapat 18 gudang garam nasional yang telah dibangun. Selain itu, sebanyak enam gudang garam lainnya akan dibangun hingga akhir 2019.

DIAS PRASONGKO | ANTARA
text:
Edhy Prabowo is Ready to Add the Capacity of the People's Salt Warehouse
05 Nov 2019, 10:35 by Dias Prasongko, Kodrat Setiawan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Minister of Maritime Affairs and Fisheries (KKP) Edhy Prabowo said he was ready to increase the warehouse capacity for community salt or produced by farmers / farmers. This step was taken in line with the geomembrane program to keep salt prices stable while increasing production and quality.
"Look for ways in which salt farmers earn a good income. One of them is through geomembrane. The making of warehouses is also quite large, we will continue to do this," Edhy said after attending a meeting at the Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs, Central Jakarta, Tuesday, November 5, 2019.
Edhy said KKP was ready if asked to increase the warehouse capacity for salt farmers. Even so, he was not sure how much additional capacity would be needed. He said he would still see further needs for farmers / farmers.
As for now the total warehouse capacity for salt owned by farmers / farmers reaches 49 thousand tons. The average salt warehouse has a capacity of between 3-4 thousand tons.
Previously, KKP planned to continue to develop various salt centers in various regions. This is done in order to produce quality salt production from salt farmers / fish farmers.
The Director General of Marine Management of KKP Brahmantya Satyamurti Poerwadi said that the program would be carried out through the People's Salt Business Program. By the end of 2018, the CTF had developed 23 districts as salt centers.
Of this total, 18 national salt warehouses have been built. In addition, as many as six other salt warehouses will be built until the end of 2019.

DIAS PRASONGKO | AMONG
